body_html:
@aziabari The necessary code change that is needed to fixed the issue you encountered has been made. In the next release of TensorFlow (I don't know but I would guess 1.4) you can update your local TensorFlow installment and the issue you encountered on you local computer would be gone.

I am not sure what is the next release date of TensorFlow (1.4) though it may take some time.

In the mean time, you can also try building TensorFlow from source: https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources

That will allows you to update your local TensorFlow installment without waiting for the official release of 1.4.

body:
@aziabari The necessary code change that is needed to fixed the issue you encountered has been made. In the next release of TensorFlow (I don't know but I would guess 1.4) you can update your local TensorFlow installment and the issue you encountered on you local computer would be gone.

I am not sure what is the next release date of TensorFlow (1.4) though it may take some time.

In the mean time, you can also try building TensorFlow from source: https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources

That will allows you to update your local TensorFlow installment without waiting for the official release of 1.4.
